item.description:
Does getting stuck in traffic on the way to the Cape or NH beaches annoy you?  Avoid the holiday traffic and head out Route 2 to beautiful Tully Lake in Royalston, MA.

We'll meet at the boat launch on Doane Hill Road, near the entrance to Tully Lake Campground.  There is a short dirt road and dirt parking lot on the opposite side of the road heading up hill from the campground entrance.   Please arrive in time to start paddling at 9:30 AM.   We'll head up the river to Long Pond and find a smaller river that heads up toward Roylaston falls.  We may be portaging over some beaver dams in that area.  Once we explore that area we can head back to the launch area and people can either leave or stay to paddle into the main lake where we can explore coves and islands and go for a swim.  Bring a lunch and we'll stop on shore somewhere or eat in our kayaks.  Plan on about 2 hours to go up to Long Pond and back and another 2+ hours out on the big lake.  The last time a bunch of us paddled here we spent almost 7 hours on the water!  Bring plenty of water, snacks and sunscreen and an appetite for adventure.  I can't remember if there are porta-potties at the launch, but there is a restroom building with flush toilets at the campground within a modest walk or short drive from the launch site.

For those who are not in a hurry to head home after paddling, there are hiking opportunities in the area (Doane's Falls, Royalston Falls and The Ledges) and there are picnic tables, grills and a rest room at the opposite end of the lake, near the dam on Route 32.  It is where the paved launch is for trailered boats. You could head home that way and have a picnic dinner.  There is also a disc golf course at the dam. I do not know what parking and table availability will be like, so you may need to be flexible.  There is so much to do in this area besides paddling!  It is a great destination for a full day of activities for those with time and stamina. 

(PLEASE NOTE - The organizers in this group are NOT trained leaders or instructors.  The organizers only set the time and place, each person participating in any group trip is responsible for their own safety.  Each participant is responsible for evaluating all relevant conditions for the trip and determining if their skills and equipment are appropriate for those conditions.)
item.how_to_find_us: Canoe Launch Parking Lot on Doane Hill Road in Royalston, MA
item.name: Paddle at Tully Lake in Royalston, MA
